title: Avantika jaiswal
author: Avantika jaiswal
content: Get Sign up and we are giving $10 for play from our side.No KYC No Scam .Sign up Details Over Telegram - @Jaizking

comments.author: Mr. Magkaisa
comments.body: Quote from: Avantika jaiswal on January 19, 2023, 11:39:37 AMGet Sign up and we are giving $10 for play from our side.No KYC No Scam .Sign up Details Over Telegram - @Jaizking   -  What do you mean by giving 10$ for play from your side?What is this also? is it a type of casino in crypto gambling too?Sign-up from where?  Your post was too incomplete details, you don't even mention the name of the site platform. what gambling you are promoting it here dude?When I checked the name of the telegram, its just an indibidual member only not a group. Therefore, your might be just one of the scammers looking for a victim here in the forum.

comments.author: Cointxz
comments.body: Quote from: Mr. Magkaisa on January 19, 2023, 12:04:43 PMQuote from: Avantika jaiswal on January 19, 2023, 11:39:37 AMGet Sign up and we are giving $10 for play from our side.No KYC No Scam .Sign up Details Over Telegram - @Jaizking   -  What do you mean by giving 10$ for play from your side?What is this also? is it a type of casino in crypto gambling too?Sign-up from where?  Your post was too incomplete details, you don't even mention the name of the site platform. what gambling you are promoting it here dude?When I checked the name of the telegram, its just an indibidual member only not a group. Therefore, your might be just one of the scammers looking for a victim here in the forum. By the look of this thread probably he is an affiliate of a casino or person in charge on marketing. Probably you will need to contact the telegram user account for the details of the casino and to get the 10$ bonus during the sign up. The title is implying that he is promoting a casino. I knew many like this guy on telegram that sending random offer if you are subscribed on telegram casino channel. Probably he is either protecting the casino from criticism here or he knew that sending affiliate link here is not allowed.Either way he really needs to provide the casino info here to save time in case it is a bullshit. But I won’t call it as scam early if deposit is not required to get that 10$ bonus and if we can withdraw it once the requirements meet. I knew some new casino that offers this kind of bonus for sign up and end up successfully before.

comments.author: QueenVera
comments.created_time: January 19, 2023, 12:10:31 PMLast edit: January 19, 2023, 12:59:18 PM by QueenVera
comments.body: @OP I'm not sure if anyone would literally pay attention to your post because it looks really suspicious and you should know that the community doesn't smile at any criminal looking post. Please don't get me wrong but I would advice that you should make a post with the casinos flier and possibly get a graphics designer to give you a nice and captivating design and possibly create an ANN thread if you're the official representative of Jaizking because you don't expect people to message you on telegram just because they got promised $10 just for play without even knowing the terms.I would advice that you write openly the terms and conditions to clam the $10 and all the terms of your casino.

comments.author: ultrloa
comments.body: Quote from: Avantika jaiswal on January 19, 2023, 11:39:37 AMGet Sign up and we are giving $10 for play from our side.No KYC No Scam .Sign up Details Over Telegram - @JaizkingMake the thread more clearer and provide necessary details about this since if many would understand what you need easily for sure they will sign up on what you are telling to them. Also put the funds on escrow since if there's no escrow involve here then might scamming issues might happen. But I also believe that this is affiliate only and you want to earn from your invites and most provably before you give that $10 they should spend first or wager.Also putting a pm me in telegram will just make you sounds like a scammer so avoid this if you are legitimately in need and put all the details in the thread.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Quote from: ultrloa on January 19, 2023, 12:16:14 PMQuote from: Avantika jaiswal on January 19, 2023, 11:39:37 AMGet Sign up and we are giving $10 for play from our side.No KYC No Scam .Sign up Details Over Telegram - @JaizkingMake the thread more clearer and provide necessary details about this since if many would understand what you need easily for sure they will sign up on what you are telling to them. Also put the funds on escrow since if there's no escrow involve here then might scamming issues might happen. But I also believe that this is affiliate only and you want to earn from your invites and most provably before you give that $10 they should spend first or wager.Also putting a pm me in telegram will just make you sounds like a scammer so avoid this if you are legitimately in need and put all the details in the thread.Definitely would be the impression by most people in this industry. If OP is not an affiliate, why would he invite people to play on their platform? more likely because of the referral bonus, unless the $10 reward is in token form of that particular site which could only be used inside but is not withdrawable. If you are not an affiliate and you are doing this for the sake of bonuses through referral, we would have no problem with that just say so. Referral bonus in the first place would be given to both invitee and inviter. 'coz if you will hide hidden motives you are just putting other players at risk if that particular site would turn out to be a scam. Please don't be like that.

comments.author: klidex
comments.body: Quote from: Avantika jaiswal on January 19, 2023, 11:39:37 AMGet Sign up and we are giving $10 for play from our side.No KYC No Scam .Sign up Details Over Telegram - @JaizkingDo you offer a gambling venue or casino site?If you offer something in this forum, you should provide all the details and information as a whole, moreover, an example of a feature must be included to attract more attention.Don't forget that you have to include a link that can go directly to the site you are offering, instead of telling them to contact via Telegram with an opinion that there is no KYC or fraud.This forum is a public forum and you cannot make an offer arbitrarily without any definite clarification. Moreover, the majority of the members of this forum are people who have quite extensive knowledge and insight.It could be that the offer that you have said is only laughed at and underestimated.

comments.author: Shamm
comments.body: Quote from: Avantika jaiswal on January 19, 2023, 11:39:37 AMGet Sign up and we are giving $10 for play from our side.No KYC No Scam .Sign up Details Over Telegram - @JaizkingOp do you have a link of your site so that we can check and see your site. OP as what other said above your details here in our forum is incomplete but maybe you are promoting your casino but I don't know what is the name is. Op just indicate more important details of your sites so that we will know what is your your site all about and also to make your ann thread professional looking you can add a picture and all the details of your casino .

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: Avantika jaiswal on January 19, 2023, 11:39:37 AMGet Sign up and we are giving $10 for play from our side.No KYC No Scam .Sign up Details Over Telegram - @JaizkingI am not really getting this, at first you did not formally make introduction of any kind, no website to look into, no details to hang unto, yet you want participants to sign up with $10 bonus to be given out upon registration, do they know what they are really signing up for? Now you say "for play from our side" and I ask which game are you talking about? Is it a casino, poker or what? Which side are you talking about? You want to give sign up details over telegram, what then happened here? If you feel here is not reliable then why making a thread here? You should have done that on telegram platform where you feel is ok for you so you could be free to give out your registration details.And you are saying no kyc no scam, I would not be surprised if it turns out to be a scam.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Too bad it's only for those who live in USA. If it's not then I would have tried the site and see if there's an issue or bugs that we can find. Anyway, Is it really NO KYC?. If it is then why only accept players or gamblers from USA only?. As what can I say about your casino even though I can't check since you didn't provide the link of the casino is that I think your casino doesn't have license because only casinos that has license will require KYC.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: A random proposal made by a newbie sound always a bit strange even if there is not intention to scam... However why only USA gamblers? If you are advertising a casino you should write clearly what is the site, explain the requirements for withdrawal etc etc (it's better for everyone people know why you're giving these 10 USD for free).

comments.author: danadc
comments.body: I am not from the USA, but I am about to go there, and I am doing everything possible to enter through a friend who is there, but I have seen that in the USA things to play in online casinos are difficult because They are prohibited, what I have thought of doing is to use VPN to access, as for the offer that the OP talks about, it seems to me 10USD to enter? That sounds strange, it sounds like an advertisement so that the OP can get many rewards, it's similar to a sharpener or something like that, it could be that I'm wrong but it seems, I don't know if the others think the same?

comments.author: len01
comments.body: I will also give the same to the members here.it would be better if you provide detailed information about whatever you are promoting here, so that we can all understand your intentions and not waste your time too long to answer on telegram and here.it's okay for you to write complete information here and you don't need to worry if you really want to build your promotion here everything will be fine.and to be honest, I'm also a little curious too, I want to know.

comments.author: Cling18
comments.body: How on earth players here would trust a casino without complete details being posted out of nowhere? There are legit ways for you to promote a casino and if you are asking to communicate with you on Telegram without showing complete details here, that will be suspicious. Telegram is a platform being invaded by scammers so it's a big risk. Not asking for Kyc isn't a reason enough for people to choose a casino. You should have posted an ANN thread as well as the complete information about the casino that you are promoting.

comments.author: darkangel11
comments.body: Quote from: bitbollo on January 19, 2023, 06:27:28 PMA random proposal made by a newbie sound always a bit strange even if there is not intention to scam... However why only USA gamblers? If you are advertising a casino you should write clearly what is the site, explain the requirements for withdrawal etc etc (it's better for everyone people know why you're giving these 10 USD for free).That's true. Also, why ask people to contact directly via Telegram, instead of just posting an affiliate link. Whoever uses the link to register gets the money on their accounts without exposing themselves on telegram, unless OP wants out telegram names to later send some ads our way Isn't it required for a casino that offers its services to US players to have KYC? What's the wager requirement for the bonus?

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Quote from: bitbollo on January 19, 2023, 06:27:28 PMA random proposal made by a newbie sound always a bit strange even if there is not intention to scam... However why only USA gamblers? If you are advertising a casino you should write clearly what is the site, explain the requirements for withdrawal etc etc (it's better for everyone people know why you're giving these 10 USD for free).First impression is important and OP is giving a fishy one, I am afraid.To give him the benefit of the doubt, we could assume he is promoting a casino which is only based/registered in the United States (which makes it sounds weird, since a USA based casino would likely ask for KYC and ten bucks are basically nothing for someone in USA).

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: nakamura12 on January 19, 2023, 06:26:30 PMToo bad it's only for those who live in USA. If it's not then I would have tried the site and see if there's an issue or bugs that we can find. Anyway, Is it really NO KYC?. If it is then why only accept players or gamblers from USA only?. As what can I say about your casino even though I can't check since you didn't provide the link of the casino is that I think your casino doesn't have license because only casinos that have a license will require KYC.Ops did not provide any link to the casino and he just mention a $10 bonus over the telegram group which is not too cool with many of us here, if ops is an affiliate then this is going to be a wasteful effort because no one will pay attention to his affiliate link. But then ops should tryas much as possible to furnish the thread with the necessary information to avoid all the misconceptions going on in this thread. And again we can say for sure if this casino allows the use of VPN from none US playerplayersf that is possible then ops can mention that to us but it is not advisable to use vpn to access restricted casinocasinosys but since ops said the casino is a none kyc compliance you may not have a problem using VPN.
